alert.note: Alert for Eastern Mogollon Rim; Little Colorado River Valley in Coconino County; Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County; Northern Gila County (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 03 at 7:48PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...Strong outflow boundary will impact portions of Gila, Navajo and Coconino Counties through 830 PM MST... At 746 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong outflow boundary along a line extending from 9 miles south of Winslow to 24 miles northwest of Clay Springs to 8 miles north of Aripine to near Pinedale. Movement was southwest at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Forest Lakes, Clay Springs, Starlight Pines, Aripine, Linden, Pinedale, Tremaine Lake, Airplane Flat Campground, Chevelon Canyon Dam, Gentry Campground, Heber-overgaard, Canyon Point Campground, Chevelon Butte, Chevelon Canyon Lake Campground, Forest Road 237 Camping Area, Chavez Mountain, Canyon Creek Fish Hatchery, Long Lake, Lewis Canyon Group Campground and Black Canyon Rim Campground. This includes the following highways... State Route 277 between mile markers 306 and 324. State Route 260 between mile markers 286 and 334. State Route 377 between mile markers 0 and 9. State Route 87 between mile markers 303 and 334. State Route 99 between mile markers 23 and 32. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Mogollon Rim; Little Colorado River Valley in Coconino County; Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County; Northern Gila County
